NameEntity: What is the name of your business?
ThisDemo: <0>ConnectToGL</0> to provide you with full view into your cash and access to liquidity solutions.
EntityAlreadyExists: Business entity already exists. Please use a different name.
WhatsTheNeed: Why do I need to connect my General Ledger?
SelectGLTitle: Select the General Ledger application used by {{entity}}
AddingSupport: We are always adding support for General Ledger applications. Please let us know which one you use.
WillAddSupport: Centime is always adapting to ensure businesses can better manage and control cash flow. We'll let you know as soon as we add support for your General Ledger application {{GL}}.
QBDUnsupported: Your version of QuickBooks Desktop is not currently supported. However, we would like to help you use Centime.
CCWillReachOut: Our customer success team will contact you to advise on options for upgrading to a supported version of QuickBooks.
EnterMobile: To enable two-step verification, please provide a mobile phone number where you wish to receive a verification code
TwoStepVerificationTitle: Increase security on your account by enabling two-step verification
EnableCode: Enable two-step verification to increase your account security
CodeSent: Please enter the verification code sent to phone number {{mobileNumberSubString}}
WhyNeedAdminAccess: Why do I need administrative access?
QBDTab1Line1: Is this your first time connecting QuickBooks Desktop to Centime?
QBDTab1Line3: Please download and install the agent on your QuickBooks Desktop server using <ourLink>thisLink</ourLink>
QBDTab1Line32: Start the Centime agent installed on your QuickBooks Desktop server
connectingFirstTime: Are you connecting for the first time?
QBDTab1Line4: Click 'NEXT' when you have successfully installed the Centime agent
QBDConnectToGLError: An internal error occured. Please try again later.
QBDTab2Line1: Start the Centime agent and you'll see a login prompt. Enter the token below and click 'log in'
QBDTab2Line12: Enter the token displayed by your Centime agent in the input box below
QBDTab2Line3: Click 'NEXT' when done and we will connect to your Centime agent
AutoFyConnectError: Connection error. Please check and enter the correct Centime agent token and then click ‘NEXT’
AutoFyConnected: Successfully connected to your Centime agent
QBDTab22Title: Enter a name for the QuickBooks Desktop instance
QBDTab22Line1: We need this in order to refer to the correct QuickBooks Desktop instance in the future
QBDTab3Title: Open the company file in QuickBooks Desktop
QBDTab3List1: QuickBooks Desktop is running in single-user mode
QBDTab3List2: You are logged in as an administrator
QBDTab3List3: The correct company file you wish Centime to connect to is open
QBDTab3List4: All other company files are closed
QBDTab3Line3: Click 'NEXT' when done. You should then see a consent popup in your QuickBooks Desktop.
AutoFyConsentError: We have not received consent. <ourLink>ClickHere</ourLink> and we'll trigger the consent popup again.
QBDTab4Title: Provide consent for access to company file
QBDTab4Line1: You should now see a popup in your QuickBooks Desktop requesting consent to access your company file. Please select the last option 'Yes. Always allow access' and continue to complete the process.
QBDTab4Line2: Your consent is needed in order to establish the connection between Centime and your company file.
QBDTab4Line3: 'NEXT' button will be enabled once your consent is received. You can then proceed by clicking on it
GLConnectStatusError: Error connecting to your General Ledger. Get support from our team using the chat bubble.
InvalidTokenError: Invalid token or token not associated with Centime. Please enter the correct token.
AllSet: Thank you! Please click the "Enter Credentials" button to continue
GoodToGo: We will present you a popup window in which you can enter your credentials
ConnectGLInfo1: Please log in to {{GLType}} via the popup.
ReConnectGLInfo1: Please reconnect by logging in to {{GLType}} from the pop-up window.
ConnectGLInfo2: If you don't see a window, please disable any pop-up blockers and <ourLink>click here</ourLink> to launch the login window again.
UnableToConnect: We were unable to connect your {{GLType}} instance due to incorrect credentials. This could either be due to change in the {{GLType}} credentials or expiry of the credentials that we have in Centime.
ReconnectByClicking: Please reconnect by clicking the Reconnect button.
warningSubTitle: We are checking a few things. This may take a few minutes.
successSubTitle: We have started syncing your data into Centime. The sync can take a few minutes up to a couple of hours, depending on the amount of data in your {{GLType}}.
successInfo: Feel free to exit the application. We'll notify you via email when the sync is complete and you can start using Centime.
errorSubTitle: We were not able to sync data from {{GLType}} for these reasons
errorInfo: Please <ourLink>download</ourLink> this report, correct the errors and try connecting again. A detailed error report has been mailed to you
ErrorSyncStatus: Unable to sync data. Your {{GLType}} login or password changed, or your credentials expired.
AdminNotified: Your account administrator has been notified.
ManuallyDisconnected: Data is not being synced. Your {{GLType}} has been disconnected by a member of your team.
ConfirmAccessTitle: You will need either of the following admin privileges in order to connect Centime with your {{GLType}}
ConfirmAccessTitleQBD: You will need either of the following admin privileges in order to connect Centime with your QuickBooks Desktop
CAPList4: Chart of Accounts consectetur adipisicing elit.
CAPRadioTitle1: Please confirm you have {{GLType}} administrative privileges
CAPRadio2: No, I don't have admin privileges
CAPRadio2Subtext: I will invite a colleague with QuickBooks admin privileges
GLConfigurationsReviewTitle: Complete these steps to connect your company to Centime
QBDTab1Content1: Are you connecting your QuickBooks Desktop instance to Centime for the first time?
ExpiredOrIncorrectCode: Verification code is incorrect or expired
CompanyAlreadyThere: This company is already connected to Centime
CompanyExistsContactAdmin: Please contact your Centime administrator and they will be able to add you as a user in the 'Team management' section
DifferentCompanyConnected: A different company was previously connected to Centime
ConnectWithSame: Please select the company previously connected to Centime
RetryAgain: Error connecting to your General Ledger. Try again using the button below or get support from our team using the chat bubble.
TooManyOTPRequests: Too many requests, please try again after 15 min
DontHaveAdminPrivileges: Don't have General Ledger admin privileges?
ConfirmAccessPanelPara1: Click 'copy invite' and a user invitation will be copied to your clipboard. Then paste this in an email and send it to a team member with General Ledger admin privileges.
ConfirmAccessPanelPara2: If they are a Centime user, they will need to click on the invite link and follow the steps to connect this business entity to the General Ledger. If they are not a Centime user, they will first need to sign up and then follow the steps to connect this business entity to the General Ledger.
ConfirmAccessPanelPara3: Once they finish the process and connect Centime to the General Ledger they can invite you as a user from the 'Team management' section in settings and you will join this business entity
WhatsTheNeedPara1: Centime helps businesses manage and control cash flows. Our solution pulls data from the General Ledger, then forecasts cash flow, monitors historical performance and improves visibility over receivables and payables.
WhatsTheNeedPara2: Centime accesses the following General Ledger information
WhatsTheNeedPara3: General Ledger accounts and associated transactions
WhatsTheNeedPara5: Sales transactions (invoices, payments, sales receipts, etc)
WhatsTheNeedPara6: Expense transactions (bills, bill payments, purchases, etc)
WhatsTheNeedPara7: Any other relevant financial transactions (like journal entries, etc)
YourDataIsSafePara1: Your data is safe with Centime.
YourDataIsSafePara2: Centime strictly adheres to industry-standard security measures to prevent unauthorized data access, maintain data accuracy and ensure legitimate use of any stored information. These measures include:
YourDataIsSafePara3: Using secure protocols — such as https — to connect and move data from your General Ledger
YourDataIsSafePara4: Encrypting your data when we store it in our system
YourDataIsSafePara5: Maintaining PCI compliance for any stored credit card information
YourDataIsSafePara6: Maintaining SOC compliance with respect to data security
YourDataIsSafePara8: Your data will never be shared with a third party, including partner banks, without your consent. Should you opt out of Centime in the future, any and all financial data in our platform will be promptly deleted.
NetSuiteSetupInfo1: Centime will need the Client Credentials that you obtained on creating the Centime’s integration record in order to initiate the connection to your Netsuite account.
NetSuiteSetupInfo2: Please enter the CONSUMER KEY and CONSUMER SECRET noted down when you created the Integration record for Centime (in Step 3) in the input fields provided below.
NetSuiteSidePanelNote: In case you have forgotten to note them down, don’t worry, you can regenerate them.
NetSuiteRegenerateInfo: In case you forgot to note your Client Credentials (CONSUMER KEY and CONSUMER SECRET), don’t worry, you can take the following actions to regenerate them.
NetSuiteRegenerateList1: Type ‘page: integrations’ in global search and click the Page: Manage Integrations result. Or navigate to Setup > Integration > Manage Integrations
NetSuiteRegenerateList2: Find and click on Centime’s Integration record that you already created.
NetSuiteRegenerateList3: On the Integration record page, scroll down and click the Edit button.
NetSuiteRegenerateList4: Then scroll down and click the Reset Credentials button.
NetSuiteRegenerateList5: You should see the Client Credentials (CONSUMER KEY and CONSUMER SECRET) displayed. Warnings: Please record them securely since NetSuite will never display these again for security reasons.
NetSuiteRegenerateBottom: You can now enter the newly regenerated CONSUMER KEY and CONSUMER SECRET in the input fields provided in this screen.
NetsuiteStep1WhyNeededPara1: In order to allow Centime to connect to your NetSuite account (note: step only required if IP address rules are enabled for your NetSuite account).
NetsuiteStep1WhyNeededPara2: This step is required only if IP address rules (Setup > Company > Enable Features > Company > Access) are enabled for your NetSuite account.
NetsuiteStep1Actions2: 2. Insert Centime’s IP address <bold>‘127.30.50.45’</bold> (comma-delimited list) in the <bold>ALLOWED IP ADDRESSES</bold> field (warning: please do not overwrite or change any existing IP addresses)
NetsuiteStep1ActionsWarning: <bold>Warning:</bold> Make sure you don't overwrite or change any existing IP addresses in this field - which will cause issues for you and other Netsuite users in your account.
NetsuiteStep1AdditionalInfo: <bold>Additional Info :</bold> Refer to “Enabling and Creating IP Address Rules” in Account Administration guide available through your Netsuite Help Center.
NetsuiteStep2WhyNeeded: In order to use Netsuite’s SuiteTalk API to extract data from your account using token-based authentication (TBA).
NetsuiteStep2Actions1: 1. Type <bold>‘page: enable’</bold> in global search and click the <bold>Page: Enable Features</bold> result. Or navigate to <bold>Setup > Company > Enable Features.</bold>
NetsuiteStep2Actions2: 2. On the <bold>Enable Features</bold> page, click the <bold>SuiteCloud </bold> subtab
NetsuiteStep2Actions3: 3. Locate the <bold>SuiteTalk (Web Services)</bold> section and check the <bold>SOAP WEB SERVICES and REST WEB SERVICES</bold> boxes (if unchecked)
NetsuiteStep2Actions4: 4. Next locate the <bold>Manage Authentication</bold> section and check <bold>TOKEN-BASED AUTHENTICATION</bold>.
NetsuiteStep2Actions5: 5. Scroll to the bottom of the page and click <bold>Save</bold>.
NetsuiteStep2AdditionalInfo: <bold>Additional Info :</bold> Refer to ‘Enabling the Token-based Authentication Feature’ in the Account Administration guide available through your NetSuite Help Center.
NetsuiteStep3WhyNeeded: In order to uniquely identify Centime in your NetSuite account.
NetsuiteStep3Actions1: 1. Type <bold>‘page: integrations’</bold> in global search and click the <bold>Page: Manage Integrations</bold> result. Or navigate to <bold>Setup > Integration > Manage integrations</bold>
NetsuiteStep3Actions2: 2. On the <bold>Integrations</bold> page, click the <bold>New</bold> button.
NetsuiteStep3Actions3: 3. On the <bold>New Integration</bold> page fill in a <bold>NAME</bold> field (example: Centime ) and select <bold>STATE</bold> as <bold>Enabled</bold>.
NetsuiteStep3Actions4: 4. In the authentication tab select <bold>TOKEN-BASED AUTHENTICATION</bold> and select <bold>TBA: AUTHORIZATION FLOW</bold> boxes and enter ‘https://api.dev.centime.com/fs/onboarding-service/1.0/redirect-handler/netsuite’ into the <bold>CALLBACK URL</bold> field.
NetsuiteStep3Actions5: 5. Click the <bold>Save</bold> button. The confirmation page will display the <bold>Client Credentials (CONSUMER KEY and CONSUMER SECRET)</bold>. Record these securely since you will need them to complete the setup in Centime. <bold>Warning</bold>: For security reasons, NetSuite will never display these again.
NetsuiteStep3Actions6: 6. Record the <bold>'Consumer Key and Secret'</bold> securely. You’ll need these credentials to complete the setup in Centime. For security reasons, NetSuite will never display these again.
NetsuiteStep3AdditionalInfo: <bold>Additional Info :</bold> Refer to ‘Enabling the Token-based authentication Feature’ in the Account Administration guide available through your Netsuite Help Center. Within that Create Integration Record section describes this step in detail.
NetsuiteStep4WhyNeeded: In order to eliminate any issues in the replication process due to Netsuite API limitations.
NetsuiteStep4Actions1: 1. Type <bold>‘page: new role’</bold> in global search and click the <bold>Page: New Role result.</bold> Or navigate to <bold>Setup > Users/Roles > Manage Roles > New</bold>
NetsuiteStep4Actions2: 2. On the <bold>Role</bold> page, enter a <bold>name</bold> for the role in the NAME field (example: Centime) and in the <bold>Authentication</bold> section, check the <bold>WEB SERVICES ONLY</bold> checkbox.
NetsuiteStep4Actions3: 3. Next, you will need to grant <bold>permissions</bold> to the role using the Permission tab by clicking a subtab within (for e.g. <bold>Transactions</bold>)
NetsuiteStep4Actions4: 4. Using the <bold>PERMISSION</bold> dropdown select the permission you want to add. Using the <bold>LEVEL</bold> dropdown select the level you want to provide for.
NetsuiteStep4Actions5: 5. Click <bold>Add</bold> to add the permission and level selected.
NetsuiteStep4Actions6: 6. Click <anchor href={"#"}>NetSuite Permissions Required</anchor> to view all the permissions and the levels required to be granted. Note: skip any permissions not found in your NetSuite account, as there may be variations in NetSuite versions.
NetsuiteStep4Actions7: 7. After you have created all the permissions, click on <bold>Save</bold>.
NetsuiteStep4AdditionalInfo: <bold>Additional Info :</bold> Refer ‘NetSuite Users & Roles’ in the Account Administration guide available through your Netsuite Help Center.
NetsuiteStep5WhyNeeded: In order to eliminate any issues in the replication process due to Netsuite API limitations.
NetsuiteStep5Actions1: 1. Type <bold>‘page: new employee’</bold> in global search and click the <bold>Page: New Employees</bold> result. Or navigate to <bold>List > Employees > Employees > New</bold>
NetsuiteStep5Actions2: 2. On the <bold>Employee</bold> page, fill up the <bold>NAME, EMAIL</bold>, and any other required fields
NetsuiteStep5Actions3: 3. Click the <bold>Access</bold> tab located on the bottom half of the page.
NetsuiteStep5Actions4: 4. In the Access tab, check <bold>GIVE ACCESS</bold>
NetsuiteStep5Actions5: 5. Also check <bold>MANUALLY ASSIGN OR CHANGE PASSWORD</bold> box and create a password for the Centime user by entering and confirming the password.
NetsuiteStep5Actions6: 6. In the <bold>Roles</bold> section, use the <bold>ROLE</bold> dropdown to locate the Centime role you created in earlier steps. Click <bold>Add</bold> once you’ve located the role.
NetsuiteStep5Actions7: 7. When finished, click <bold>Save</bold> to create the user.
NetsuiteStep5AdditionalInfo: <bold>Additional Info :</bold> Refer ‘NetSuite Users & Roles’ in the Account Administration guide available through your Netsuite Help Center.
NetsuiteStep2Heading: Enable Web Services & Token based authentication
NetsuiteStep3Heading: Create an Integration Record for Centime
NetsuiteStep4Heading: Create a Centime Netsuite Role & Configure Permissions
GLConnectError: Invalid token. Please enter the correct token below or get support from our team using the chat bubble.
MultiUser: Is your company file accessed through a multi-user network?
NeedAdminAccessFor3Party: Note: You will need administrative access to the server hosted by the third-party hosting service
NeedAdminAccessToCompanyServer: Note: You will need administrative access to the company server in order to install the Centime Agent
QBDVersionInfo: You can find the version displayed on the title bar of the QuickBooks Desktop application
